translation.en: [female officer] Can you tell me your full name?
Yasmin Sundermeyer.
translation.ja: ヤスミン･サンダーメイヤー

translation.en: [female officer] This is the first time you're arrested for a felony charge, so I have to get your DNA.
translation.ja: 初めての重罪につき ＤＮＡと―

translation.en: It's just a mouth swab and a few fingerprints. Okay?
Stand right here on the white X.
Face the screen.
Do your left hand first.
So, young lady...
you seriously did... or allegedly did all this stuff in those house shoes right there?
translation.ja: 本当に君はスリッパで これだけの犯罪を？

translation.en: Now they're all dirty.
[male office] Have you been here before? Any jail?
No?
Did you flee? Did you run?
Got up to, like, 130.
I got away, but then I got caught.
translation.ja: でも 捕まっちゃった

translation.en: So you really didn't get away, did you now?
Open up your mouth.
So, you know what's going to happen, right? The process?
translation.ja: この後のプロセスは分かる？

translation.en: You have the right to bail. What's your bail?
translation.ja: 保釈金で外に出られる

translation.en: Hundred thousand dollars.
Someone can bail you out. Otherwise, you're gonna see a judge on Tuesday.
translation.ja: 都合できなければ 火曜から裁判だ

translation.en: So... you'll get arraigned,
you'll enter your plea, and then go from there.
translation.ja: 弁明した後は成り行きだ

translation.en: Questions, comments, concerns?
All right.
Best of luck to you.
Head all the way down to your left.
You can use the phone in there.
You can call any of the bail bondsman's numbers or any of your family members or friends.
translation.ja: 保釈金の立替業者か 家族にかけられる

translation.en: [woman shouts] Hello?
Hello?
Hello?
[woman] Oh, my fucking God!
What are you doing?
Being in here in jail, it'll break you.
Nobody in their right mind wants to be sitting in a cell like this, caged up.
translation.ja: 正常な人間なら こんな所 我慢できない

translation.en: And this place is clearly crazy.
[female officer] At the Sacramento County Main Jail, there are over 2,400 male and female inmates.
translation.ja: サクラメントの郡刑務所には 2400人以上の囚人がいる

translation.en: Jail is like a small town, but not like a normal small town.
translation.ja: まるで小さな町ね でも普通じゃない

translation.en: You gotta pick up on a whole new set of rules.
Everyone is in everybody's business because our lives are really right on top of each other.
translation.ja: 生活に関わるから 力関係には敏感ね

translation.en: There's no privacy in jail. We're women, we get periods.
You know? We all gotta use the restroom, all that, you gotta get used to that.
translation.ja: 全て男と共有で プライバシーもない

translation.en: [inmate] And then there's relationship drama, so it gets even worse in here.
translation.ja: 恋愛になるとひどいもんよ

translation.en: One day, the one girl is dating one girl and the next day somebody is dating somebody else.
translation.ja: 女同士でも毎日 違う女とヤッてるわ

translation.en: It's like a cluster fuck.
You gotta know who's around you, you gotta know who you can trust. You gotta know all your enemies.
translation.ja: 誰が味方で誰が敵なのか 把握する必要がある

translation.en: [guard] Back it up.
Go to your cells now!
[inmate] But when you find a good friend in here it makes the time very easy.
translation.ja: 友達ができれば ここでも楽しめる

translation.en: I'm not gonna let this place eat me up or make me miserable.
[inmate] We might be locked up physically but mentally and emotionally, I'm-- I'm free as fuck.
translation.ja: 体は檻の中だろうけど 心や感情は自由さ

translation.en: Can't nothing stop my shine.
-I'm rollin'! -I'm rollin'!
But it's really bad still. Like, I hate it.
♪ You better kill me first ♪
♪ Lay me down on the ground, crucify me ♪
translation.ja: ジェイルバード ―塀の中の生存競争―

translation.en: [male voice on PA] All right, ladies, once again, come out...
translation.ja: レディーたち　外に出ろ

translation.en: then we'll do day room.
Whatcha doing? You draw my picture yet?
You got talent, girl! You're gonna go somewhere in life.
translation.ja: 才能あるもんね　大物になる

translation.en: We're a jail, so most people that are housed here
translation.ja: 刑務所ですから― ほとんどの囚人は 出廷の日を待っています

translation.en: are either waiting to go to court
translation.ja: ほとんどの囚人は 出廷の日を待っています ほとんどの囚人は 出廷の日を待っています ターナー刑務官

translation.en: or they're waiting to be sentenced.
translation.ja: ほとんどの囚人は 出廷の日を待っています ターナー刑務官

translation.en: We see all different types of arrests.
Ones from DUI all the way to homicide.
translation.ja: ヤク中から殺人までね

translation.en: All right, I need a shower after you.
I would get in with her, but we can't.
Ten percent of the population here are women, and they're only housed on the 7th floor.
translation.ja: 10％が女性で 房は７階に限られています

translation.en: -[door knocks] -What's going on?
[inmate] Let me out!
I need you to calm down
and wait for your turn to go out for day room, all right?
translation.ja: 自分の自由時間まで 待つように

translation.en: By law, they only have to let you out for, like, three hours out of the week.
translation.ja: 法律が許す自由時間は 週に３時間だけ

translation.en: Our shifts over here, like, our officers are pretty cool.
translation.ja: ここの看守は気が利くわ

translation.en: So they'll run day room, like, once or twice throughout the day.
translation.ja: １日１～２回は デイルームに出してくれる

translation.en: [inmate] Oh, shit!
-[inmate] Good coffee? -Yeah. Thank you.
translation.ja: おいしい？ うん　どうも

translation.en: The things we do in jail.
Are you getting in the shower?
[Shawn] I'm in the shower after you, bruh.
[Shawn] I've been here for almost 90 days
translation.ja: ショーン ほぼ90日 居るから もうすぐ出られる ほぼ90日 居るから もうすぐ出られる

translation.en: and I'm finally getting out of here.
translation.ja: ほぼ90日 居るから もうすぐ出られる

translation.en: Just the anticipation of knowing that I'm going to be free
and be able to walk around, go get food when I want to,
translation.ja: 自由に出かけてご飯を食べて

translation.en: use the bathroom without having people around me and it smelling like boo boo.
translation.ja: 周りを気にせず トイレも使える

translation.en: Teddy, what you got in that bag?
Did you come in with some dope?
Yeah, I got you a doodoo, baby, I got you.
-You do? -I got you a doodoo.
translation.ja: あげようか？ もちろん 欲しい

translation.en: I sure do need it. [chuckles]
I am a convicted armed robber with two strikes.
translation.ja: 強盗で捕まったの　２度目よ

translation.en: Last time I was here, I did 45 days
translation.ja: 前は45日間だったけど 今回は90日になった 前は45日間だったけど 今回は90日になった ゲイロン･ビーソン 36歳

translation.en: and then this time I'm doing 90 days.
translation.ja: 前は45日間だったけど 今回は90日になった 前は45日間だったけど 今回は90日になった 罪状　逃走罪 仮釈放中の逮捕

translation.en: Being in jail sometimes can get easy for me.
translation.ja: 塀の中の方が楽な時もある

translation.en: Is your tongue split? Can you go like this?
I get along good with girls because of the way that I look.
translation.ja: 見た目のせいか 女子と仲良くできる

translation.en: I guess it's my flirtatious personality.
Okay, I want to get my ears gauged. Does it hurt?
translation.ja: 耳に穴をあけると痛い？

translation.en: No.
No.
Hella ratchet.
Hey, I like it.
There's always somebody that wants to do something, that wants to cook for me, that wants to give me things.
translation.ja: 誰かが料理してくれたり 物をくれたりするの

translation.en: You can use my phone time, it's good.
I can use your phone time?
But I'm married.
Even though I'm a big flirt, I don't want nobody else but my wife.
translation.ja: イチャつくけど私には妻だけ

translation.en: And so I'm gonna keep my spit in my mouth and my hands to myself.
translation.ja: 唾も手も他の人には使わない

translation.en: [unintelligible yelling] Let me play with your ear! Ah!
Which is going to be...
Yeah, I'ma stay to myself.
Thank you. You are a gem. You just saved my life.
translation.ja: ありがとう　助かる

translation.en: Girl, I was supposed to be outta here four days ago.
-Really? -Yes. Crazy.
[Shawn] It started off when I was young. My first robbery...
translation.ja: 最初の強盗は若い時だったわ

translation.en: It was kinda funny, 'cause we were watching-- I was at the movies.
translation.ja: カノジョと映画館に居た

translation.en: And I was with my ex girlfriend. We were watching one of those shoot 'em up bang-bang movies.
translation.ja: 銃撃戦の映画を 見てたんだけど

translation.en: We were carrying knives.
And I kinda just hinted around like, "We should rob these girls behind us."
translation.ja: 何となく後ろの子を 襲おうと言ってみたの

translation.en: So, at the end of the movie, she was like, "You ready?" I was like, "For what?"
translation.ja: 見終わった時に 彼女がやるかと聞くから

translation.en: She was like, "To go rob these girls." And I was like, "You're serious?"
translation.ja: 最初は何のことかと思った

translation.en: And I'll never forget, she asked one of the girls, "Can I have some change?"
translation.ja: 彼女が声をかけた “小銭を貸してくれない？”

translation.en: And the girl was like, "Yeah, sure. How much you need?"
She was like, "Matter of fact, can I have your whole purse?"
So, we pulled out the knives... and we took their purse,
translation.ja: そしてナイフを見せて バッグを奪った

translation.en: and it was the most pointless thing that I've ever done.
translation.ja: あんなムダはないわね

translation.en: We didn't get no money from it.
And it kinda started a chain of events that just spiraled out of control.
translation.ja: その後は連鎖的に 繰り返してしまった

translation.en: -You wanna play? -I don't know how to play.
-You know how to play? -Uh-huh.
[Shawn] Do you wanna...
...buy some pills?
- Buy some what? - Pills
-The pills? -Do you want to?
Oh. Like what?
Um... noo-noos?
Or na-nas.
What's noo-noos or na-nas?
Neuron?
Okay, hold on.
Some black?
Oh! Hell no, not that.
Booda!
Explain to her what a na-na make you feel like.
- Man, I love it. I fucking love it -[Shawn chuckles]
Makes you feel like you smoked a blunt.
Oh, no. I'm good.
-I don't like it. -But in a good way.
There's like microphones over my head.
Oh.
This was just a drill.
Everybody says that I'm a monster, but looks can be deceiving.
translation.ja: 見た目だけで怪物呼ばわり

translation.en: I've got almost half my body covered in tattoos.
translation.ja: 体の半分にタトゥーがある 体の半分にタトゥーがある モンスター

translation.en: I kind of have, like, my good and innocent side
translation.ja: モンスター 純粋さと怪物の部分が 共存してるの

translation.en: and then my monster side.
translation.ja: 純粋さと怪物の部分が 共存してるの

translation.en: Girl, you know you want this dick.
I'm from the east coast.
So, I grew up over there.
translation.ja: 出身は東海岸よ ニューヨークに住んでいた

translation.en: I was living in New York.
translation.ja: ニューヨークに住んでいた

translation.en: I was happy.
I had my own place. I was running a business on 5th Avenue.
I was doing tattoo conventions.
translation.ja: タトゥー･コンベンションも 開いた

translation.en: Then side money would be, like, hustling and selling drugs.
translation.ja: 副業でも もうけてたわ ドラッグを売ってたの

translation.en: I got locked up on the east coast. I did three months over there, then once I got released, I came over here,
translation.ja: ３カ月 服役した後 こっちに移り住んで―

translation.en: and I've been mainly in the streets, just hustling and doing that whole thing.
translation.ja: 道で同じように売っていた

translation.en: My charges originally were possession of a stolen vehicle, GTA,
translation.ja: 最初は車の盗難で捕まった 最初は車の盗難で捕まった メーガン･ホーキンス 28歳

translation.en: transportation of narcotics,
13 pounds of weed, 65 grams of meth,
translation.ja: 麻薬６キロと 覚せい剤 65グラム

translation.en: fictitious checks, and catching felonies while out on bail.
translation.ja: 小切手の偽装と 仮釈放中の重罪もよ

translation.en: It took me getting locked up to, like, look at my life
translation.ja: ムショで人生を振り返ると バカをしたと思うわ

translation.en: and be like, "Okay, you're fucking up, you're fucking up.
translation.ja: ムショで人生を振り返ると バカをしたと思うわ こうなった理由を考える

translation.en: What are you doing that got you in here?
translation.ja: こうなった理由を考える

translation.en: What's the real reason I'm in here? Or, you know, how am I treating people?"
translation.ja: 誰かにひどいことを したから？

translation.en: [producer] Well, and frankly, you're also committing crimes.
translation.ja: 犯罪をおかしたからよ

translation.en: Well, yes, I mean, that too, but... [chuckles]
Hi, I need to bail myself out.
Given my experience,
it is unusual for a first-time offender to come into custody
translation.ja: 彼女のような重罪で 拘留された人は 彼女のような重罪で 拘留された人は サラザール刑務官

translation.en: with as serious of charges as she has.
translation.ja: サラザール刑務官 今までいませんでした

translation.en: Miss Sundermeyer's bail is set at $100,000.
translation.ja: 保釈金10万ドルを 払えない場合は

translation.en: If she does not post bail, she will be here until her arraignment.
translation.ja: 認否手続きまで ここに拘留されます

translation.en: [bail bondsman] Okay. How much is your bail?
I can't hear what you're saying.
One hundred thousand.
One hundred thousand?
Okay. What did you get arrested for?
I got arrested for carjacking.
translation.ja: カージャックで捕まった

translation.en: Okay, how much money do you have for bail?
How much is it to do a payment plan?
I can do--
I don't even know who you are.
Okay, my name is--
You won't give me how much money you have.
You're just bullshit. You hear that? [phone line beeps]
translation.ja: 信用できない　ペテンよ

translation.en: I'm bullshit?
What the fuck?
I'm bullshit, I guess. I'm just bullshit.
Hi, I need to bail myself out. It's for a $100,000 bail.
translation.ja: 保釈金10万ドルを 借りたいんですが…

translation.en: Eight thousand?
How much can we do for a payment plan?
translation.ja: 分割だと いくらですか？

translation.en: -[unintelligible] -You can't do any less than that?
I can do, like, $500.
I don't know. I just wanna go home.
translation.ja: 分からない　帰りたいの

translation.en: [sobbing] I'm not going to see my baby.
[Yasmin] I'm not a mean person. I want to be a veterinarian, like...
translation.ja: 悪人じゃないわ 獣医になりたいの

translation.en: I want to be back to how it was before, going to school,
translation.ja: 学校に通ってた頃に戻りたい

translation.en: when I was happy, seeing my baby happy. Like, that just all made me happy.
translation.ja: 子供の顔を見られて 全てが幸せなの

translation.en: I was supposed to be at work today at seven...
or something. I don't know. I just...
translation.ja: 出勤するはずだったのに もう分からない

translation.en: I need to stop.
I just wanna be happy.
I always do this to myself.
translation.ja: なのに自分を苦しめる

translation.en: I'll have everything, you know, being good,
translation.ja: いい人間でいれば 幸せなのに

translation.en: instead I just ruin it.
[Shawn] I get to go! I'm so excited.
translation.ja: サヨナラ　ワクワクする

translation.en: So now I'm just waiting to get released.
They'll probably release you after dinner.
[chuckles] Oh, my God. I'm going back to sleep.
I'm not gonna be able to sleep. Hope they give us day room.
translation.ja: デイルームで過ごしたい

translation.en: Yeah, I don't see how you'll be able to sleep. [chuckles]
I'm ready to go. I can't believe it.
translation.ja: 待てない　ウソみたいよ

translation.en: Look, man...
This is my old bunkie. Like, I love her. I love her so much.
translation.ja: 彼女とはずっとルームメイト

translation.en: You guys always find a way back to each other. It's precious.
translation.ja: 必ず一緒になってるわね

translation.en: I feel like-- I keep fighting a lot, huh? And don't realize it.
translation.ja: 私もケンカするけど 自覚がない

translation.en: Yeah, you do.
-I thought I fought a lot. -That part, though.
translation.ja: 私はケンカっぱやい まあね

translation.en: People don't fuck with me no more.
I got into four fights already.
translation.ja: もう４回ケンカした もう４回ケンカした ヌーニー

translation.en: Some people call me sweet, some people call me mean. Like...
translation.ja: ヌーニー 優しいとも意地悪とも 言われる

translation.en: I am who I am.
translation.ja: ヌーニー でも私は私よ

translation.en: I'm a...
nice ass real bitch.
I love this lady right here. She is so crazy.
translation.ja: この人 大好き クレイジーでさ

translation.en: I can honestly sit here and say, like, I trust her with my life.
translation.ja: 人生を預けられるほど 信頼してるわ

translation.en: Wouldn't want to be anyone else's bunkie.
[Noonie] She's my lighter to a cigarette, like... Like that, you know? Like... We go together, so...
translation.ja: タバコとライターみたいに いつも一緒に居るの

translation.en: -[Monster] Love you, Noonie! -We're just...
I love you, too, Monster.
translation.ja: 私もよ　モンスター

translation.en: I'm in here for pimping and pandering.
translation.ja: 売春で捕まった 売春で捕まった ナジェラ･ジョーンズ 27歳

translation.en: Um, my bail is $1,000,000.
translation.ja: ナジェラ･ジョーンズ 27歳 ナジェラ･ジョーンズ 27歳 保釈金は100万ドル

translation.en: I've been here for a year-- Thirteen months, actually.
translation.ja: 罪状　売春とあっせん 13カ月 ここに居る

translation.en: I had a pretty decent childhood.
translation.ja: 子供の頃はまともでね

translation.en: I mean, I was in and out of foster care.
Everybody dreams of being a lawyer and a doctor,
translation.ja: 皆の夢は弁護士か医者

translation.en: but I wanted to be a social worker, because I was in and out of the system.
translation.ja: 私はお世話になった 福祉士になりたかった

translation.en: I'ma go back to school when I get out, go to college, you know.
translation.ja: 出所したら大学に行くつもり

translation.en: I'm not really trippin'.
Noham.
Hey, you on the end. Your feet that way.
translation.ja: 端っこの君　あっち

translation.en: Two more fingers. We have two more fingers.
[male officer] File in.
I am getting her jail clothing ready.
translation.ja: 〝女子更衣室〞 囚人服を準備してるの 囚人服を準備してるの

translation.en: She said she's not gonna bail out and she'd like to go upstairs.
translation.ja: ヤスミンは上の房に入る

translation.en: So, this is the jail rolls.
Jail shoes.
Our jail underwear and bra.
So, sometimes we have brand new ones, and then sometimes...
translation.ja: 真新しい物があるかも…

translation.en: they look like this.
Pull that door.
So, I'm going to need you to get fully undressed.
translation.ja: 着てる物は全て脱いで

translation.en: Put all your clothing in this clear plastic bag.
translation.ja: この袋に入れてください

translation.en: Okay. Completely naked. Socks, shoes, everything. Okay.
translation.ja: 全裸になって 靴下も靴も脱いで

translation.en: Thank you.
All right, now turn, face me. Stand on those yellow footprints.
translation.ja: こっちを向いて 黄色いマークの上に立つ

translation.en: Bend forward at the waist.
Reach behind you from behind with both hands,
translation.ja: 手を足の間に入れて 背中の方に

translation.en: spread yourself open, cough hard three times.
You have to get your fingers closer to your vagina,
translation.ja: 自分の指で膣を広げて

translation.en: spread yourself open, cough hard three times.
Okay.
Here's your clothing. Get dressed.
And then come on out. Stand right here and face the wall.
Hands are considered weapons in this facility,
so make sure they're in the front waistband of your pants whenever you're walking by any kind of staff.
translation.ja: スタッフとすれ違う時は ベルトの前に入れて

translation.en: Seven East from female booking. One en route, escorted.
We're heading this way, to your right.
[Salazar] Let's walk up these stairs.
[inmate] We don't want you!
That's my friend.
[Yasmin] I have a question. This cell is dirty.
translation.ja: この部屋 汚れてるわ

translation.en: Can I get a clean cell?
No, you can't get a different cell.
But I just want one that was wiped off.
Yeah, it was. Our workers cleaned. There's nothing on the ground.
translation.ja: してあるわ 床に何も落ちてない

translation.en: [man] Okay, yuck it up, ass-jackal. You're on camera.
translation.ja: 笑え　カメラが来たぞ

translation.en: [Wolverine] Being on the Trustee floor is so different.
Bro, we've got it made here, bro.
We get food, we get our own cell,
translation.ja: 食事は自由だし 個室にテレビあるし 電話もかけ放題

translation.en: we get TVs, we get... phones all day.
translation.ja: 個室にテレビあるし 電話もかけ放題

translation.en: We can sit in the hallway and look at all the women.
-All day! -All day long.
I see you!
She was screaming last time.
[man] We're called workers, or trustees. We all have to wear these white shirts.
translation.ja: 運営委員は 作業員とも呼ばれている

translation.en: You know, you have to get classified and go through a certain criteria to be eligible to work down here.
translation.ja: 一定の基準をクリアすると 作業員になれる

translation.en: We work our asses off down here.
[Wolverine] What's up, pimp?
High-five! High-five!
Ha, gotcha! [chuckles]
Oh, my God.
[Wolverine] What's up with you, girl?
I'm doing all right.
Just slip on through.
Yeah.
Funny thing, you making friends always everywhere we go.
translation.ja: あちこちで 友達を作ってるよな

translation.en: Hey, what do you want me to do?
I'm a friendly guy, you know?
translation.ja: フレンドリーなんでね フレンドリーなんでね ウルヴァリン

translation.en: [Wolverine] We're going to seven where all his fans are.
[man] Oh, yeah!
All the girls are gonna be, "Oh! Wolverine!"
translation.ja: 女子が叫ぶ “ウルヴァリンだわ”

translation.en: [man] Happens every time.
Look at him.
He has the chops, the hair. That's his hero.
translation.ja: もみあげと髪形がヒーローだ

translation.en: [Wolverine] When I was in prison about eight years ago,
we didn't have access to mirrors and razors, but maybe once a month,
translation.ja: 鏡もカミソリも使えなくて 手入れは月に１度だけ

translation.en: so I just kinda cut it, and then there were telling me, "You look like Wolverine,"
translation.ja: ウルヴァリンに似てると 言われ出して

translation.en: so I kinda went with it. Gives me strength, you know? Be something strong, you know what I mean?
translation.ja: それ以来 このスタイルだ 強くなった気がする

translation.en: Hopefully it's my last trip here. Been here a lot of times.
translation.ja: ムショ暮らしは最後にしたい ムショ暮らしは最後にしたい ロバート･ワフ 44歳

translation.en: I'm trying to find some help when I get out there,
translation.ja: 罪状　身元詐称 懲役　１８０日間 罪状　身元詐称 懲役　１８０日間 周りに助けてもらいながら

translation.en: so I don't end up back here, at the same spot.
translation.ja: 罪状　身元詐称 懲役　１８０日間 今度こそ生まれ変わる 今度こそ生まれ変わる

translation.en: [chuckles] What's up?
Generally, we're not allowed to communicate with the females. Sometimes we cross paths.
translation.ja: 女との会話は禁止だ 接触はあるけどな

translation.en: What's up, girl? What's happening? You know what I mean?
translation.ja: 君たち　何か欲しいの？

translation.en: They come up and they ask me to sign my poster, all that. I can't do that.
translation.ja: サインを頼まれるけど できない

translation.en: I love cupcakes.
I got cupcakes. I mean...
translation.ja: ここにある ほらな

translation.en: [Becky] Well, those are not very fluffy.
What's wrong with them? They're fluffy.
[Becky] More squats.
More squats? Oh!
That's out.
[male officer] What are you doing on this floor?
[Wolverine] I don't want to get fired.
Bye, Becky.
-[man] I knew you'd get us in trouble. -[Wolverine chuckles]
[Rowland] Those male workers should not have been talking to those female workers.
translation.ja: 本来は女子との会話は禁止よ

translation.en: [male officer] I guess that's why they don't call them trustees any more, right?
translation.ja: だから運営委員とは 呼べない

translation.en: Yeah. Understatement.
[male officer] They call 'em workers.
You know, what's crazy is you go to eighth floor,
where a lot of your... shot callers are,
translation.ja: あそこは“ボス”が大勢いる

translation.en: and if those guys have clout enough to get dope through the workers,
translation.ja: 奴らの影響力が増すと 作業員を通じて

translation.en: it just comes straight from the eighth floor, the top floor, all the way down.
translation.ja: ８階から下まで ヤクが横行しちまう

translation.en: At first I thought it was an issue on seven and eight,
translation.ja: ７階と８階だけかと 思っていたけど

translation.en: but then you're finding it on...
-all the floors. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 全部の階に問題が… ああ

translation.en: A lot of the girls here have ties with some of their male inmate counterparts,
translation.ja: 女の作業員は男の作業員と つながっていて

translation.en: and I just see a lot of them putting themselves in stupid positions they don't need to put themselves in.
translation.ja: 自分たちを不利な立場に 追いやっているのよ

translation.en: That's why we gotta keep hitting cells.
-Yeah. -Maybe they'll get the hint not to...
translation.ja: ええ ヤクのやり取りは減るはずだ

translation.en: float dope through.
translation.ja: ヤクのやり取りは減るはずだ

translation.en: Yeah.
Make your way to your rooms. Let's go.
[Shayna] Girl, cut that shit.
[Tayler] Cut that shit up.
The fuckin' boys moved everything.
translation.ja: 男どもが動かしたんだ

translation.en: I dunno where anything's at. Bunch of assholes.
translation.ja: 場所が分からなくなった

translation.en: [Shayna] Shayna Wimberly.
translation.ja: 私はシャイナ･ウィンバリー

translation.en: I'm Tayler Coatney.
translation.ja: テイラー･コートニーよ

translation.en: And we work night shift together.
We do chore time and clean up after the girls.
translation.ja: 女子が出すゴミを 掃除する 女子が出すゴミを 掃除する テイラー

translation.en: We're supposed to be role models. Sometimes, we kind of...
translation.ja: 模範を示す立場だから シャイナ 忙しいけどね　楽しんでるわ

translation.en: We get a little out of hand, but we have fun with it.
translation.ja: 忙しいけどね　楽しんでるわ

translation.en: -[Tayler] I want to hit you with it. -[Shayna] Yeah, I know.
translation.ja: これで殴りたい 知ってる

translation.en: [Shayna] You get more freedom being a worker.
We can go into other pods. We can shower, use the phone.
translation.ja: 違う部屋に行けるし シャワーも使える

translation.en: [Tayler] My door's always popped. Like, all day is day room. It's nice.
translation.ja: 自分の部屋も いつでも出られるわ

translation.en: [Shayna] This girl just came into booking.
[Tayler] Where is she? At 28?
[Shayna] Is that her?
-[Yasmin] Hello. -What's your name?
Yasmin.
Yasmin? That's a pretty name.
Thank you.
-[Yasmin] What's your name? -Tayler.
translation.ja: あなたは？ テイラー

translation.en: -Nice to meet you. -I'm Shayna.
[Shayna] We overheard that some girl came in here with a Sawzall blade and a fully loaded pipe and a lighter
translation.ja: 電ノコを持ち込んだ 女がいると聞いていたのよ

translation.en: -inside of her. -Yeah, like, she--
Shoved in her, you know, nani.
So, we were-- I was like...
-[chuckles] It was so bad! -She had a hospital band on, and she, like...
translation.ja: 病院の患者リストバンドを つけて

translation.en: I'm like, "She's walking kinda funny. Maybe that was her, you know."
translation.ja: おかしな歩き方をしてるはず

translation.en: -[both laugh] -[Tayler] I really thought that was her!
But I mean, like, she's not like that at all.
translation.ja: でも想像と全然 違った

translation.en: She looks super innocent, you know?
If you don't mind us asking, what are you in here for?
Carjacking.
-[Tayler] That's no fun. How old are you? -I'm 19.
[Tayler] Nineteen? Me, too!
[Yasmin] I'm facing five felonies.
[Shayna] She said carjacking. She made it up.
translation.ja: カージャックだってさ

translation.en: There's "carjacking, assault with deadly weapon on peace officer,
translation.ja: “それと保安官を 凶器で殴り…”

translation.en: receiving known stolen motor vehicle, reckless driving, alcohol and drugs."
translation.ja: “車の盗難　無謀運転と 飲酒とヤク”

translation.en: Oh, my.
Well, she was on a good one, right?
What time do we come out?
[Tayler] Day room is really whenever they feel like offering it.
Try to use the phone and try to get a shower in, 'cause you don't know when your next one's gonna be.
translation.ja: 電話もシャワーも 使える時に使った方がいい

translation.en: -[Yasmin] I wanna see my mom. -[Shayna] It's going to be okay, okay?
translation.ja: ママに会いたい 大丈夫　乗り越えられる

translation.en: You'll get through this.
translation.ja: 大丈夫　乗り越えられる

translation.en: I'm not gonna lie to you, it's not gonna be easy, but...
translation.ja: 正直言えば 大変だけど

translation.en: you'll be okay.
We will see you in a little bit. Okay?
-We'll come check on you, okay? -Try to take it easy.
translation.ja: 見に来るわ 気を楽に

translation.en: [Tayler] She was like... evading and like, assault with a deadly weapon? Look at her!
translation.ja: 保安官を凶器で 殴るようには見えないわ

translation.en: -She's going to be here a minute. -[Tayler] Yeah.
translation.ja: いずれ受け入れる 裁判に２カ月はかかるしね

translation.en: She'll probably be fighting her case for a couple months.
translation.ja: 裁判に２カ月はかかるしね

translation.en: [Shayna] I mean, I thought I would be fighting mine for a couple months.
I've been here ten months.
I don't even know how many days I have.
translation.ja: 刑期の計算 いつ出られるか？ いつ出られるか？

translation.en: I might have forever. I might leave tomorrow. I don't know.
translation.ja: 分からないわ　明日かもね

translation.en: I'll be here... I don't know how long.
translation.ja: 何年居るかしら　覚えてない

translation.en: Long time. I don't even count no more.
I'm just trying to, trying to wiggle the numbers around and see what I can do with it.
translation.ja: どうすれば短くなるか 計算してるわ

translation.en: My max was nine years,
translation.ja: 最長で９年のはずだったけど

translation.en: and doubled, since I'm a striker.
He wanted to do four years doubled, which means eight years.
translation.ja: 司法取引で２倍の計算よ

translation.en: With the seven years and 85%,
I've already been two years flat.
I have to do a 90-day commitment first,
translation.ja: 最初は90日の拘束だった

translation.en: and then consecutive 150 days with half.
translation.ja: その後150日の半分が 追加された

translation.en: That offer came down to 16 months doubled.
Eighty-five percent of seven would be, like, five years, eight months.
And then two years on top of that that'd be like three years, eight months.
translation.ja: それ引く２年だから あと３年８カ月ね

translation.en: Which means 32 months.
Once I get there, they'll knock off 16 months.
And then 85% hopefully will go down to 66% when I get over the wall in prison.
translation.ja: でも85％じゃなく66％に 減刑された場合は…

translation.en: I have four months already in,
which doubles to eight months, so I would have eight months left.
translation.ja: ８カ月居る計算で 残りは８カ月

translation.en: It would just be way lower than that. I'd probably have two years left to do.
translation.ja: もっと早く出られる あと２年かな

translation.en: So...
-[producer] I'm a little confused. -[inmate laughs]
So I'm fucked.
Yeah. Don't go to jail. [chuckles]
[male officer] Chow-time, chow-time, chow-time.
Pop your doors. Come out and grab one tray
and return to your cell. Do not try to grab an extra tray for yourself.
translation.ja: 部屋に戻ること １つだけだぞ

translation.en: That's a long-ass line!
Whatcha want me to do? Push these bitches out the way?
See this nasty-ass food?
Fake-ass chicken strips.
translation.ja: チキンフィンガーもどきと

translation.en: This some beans. Nasty-ass carrots.
translation.ja: 何これ　豆？ あとニンジン

translation.en: [Monster] That's called, "I'm hungry."
I don't know if I'm doing this pruno right, but... [inhales]
translation.ja: これでプルノができるかしら

translation.en: It's really just oranges and pineapples, but...
translation.ja: オレンジとパイナップル…

translation.en: we probably won't get no more pineapples.
translation.ja: でもパイナップルが足りない

translation.en: [Monster] Pruno is alcohol.
It's usually made with fruit.
[Noonie] I always make the best mother-fucking drink.
It's not infrequent for us to find pruno,
translation.ja: 房を点検するとひんぱんに

translation.en: as far as cell searches and shakedowns are concerned. We'll obviously confiscate it.
translation.ja: プルノが見つかるので 没収します

translation.en: It's one of the easiest things to make in jail, as long as you have some form of a sugary substance,
translation.ja: 果物などの糖分があれば 簡単に作れるんです

translation.en: access to fruit, which we give them on a daily basis
translation.ja: 果物などの糖分があれば 簡単に作れるんです 果物は毎日 出ますし 果物は毎日 出ますし ローランド刑務官

translation.en: and warm water, which they also have access to.
translation.ja: ローランド刑務官 温かい水も手に入るので 作れてしまう

translation.en: You put it in a bag, wait for like a week or so...
translation.ja: 袋に入れて １週間ぐらい待つの

translation.en: You gotta burp it when the bag blows up.
translation.ja: 発酵したら空気を抜けば

translation.en: Then it's done.
[Drea] Whatcha doing in there, girl?
-Bitch there's nothing but food in here. -[laughter]
[Noonie] Leave me alone.
Better, like, talking to my fucking self.
[Drea] Okay.
All right!
I don't fuck with Drea.
I'm here for burglary.
translation.ja: ドレア 強盗で捕まったの 強盗で捕まったの

translation.en: Jail gets a little boring, so I like to entertain myself
translation.ja: 罪状　強盗 保護観察中の違反 ムショ暮らしは退屈だから ムショ暮らしは退屈だから

translation.en: and my way of doing that is with females.
[Drea] I have a lot of females in here that do want to be with me.
translation.ja: 私と付き合いたい女は 沢山いるわ

translation.en: There's kinda a lot of ducks in here. There's not really too many pretty people right now.
translation.ja: あまりカワイイ子は いないけど

translation.en: I'm not gonna waste my time with no ducks.
Unless they're profitable.
If they got something for me, commissary or something. I don't know.
translation.ja: 売店の物を 都合してくれたりね

translation.en: You've got straight bitches, bisexual bitches,
translation.ja: ここにはバイもいるけど

translation.en: and then you got bi-choosy bitches.
Wait, you're telling me I'm choosy?
There's always drama behind Drea.
translation.ja: トラブルメーカーよ トラブルメーカーよ プリンセス

translation.en: She wants attention whether it be negative or positive. She's an agitator.
translation.ja: 良くも悪くも目立ちたがりで 人を挑発する

translation.en: If she causes an argument with somebody, it gets our day room shut down.
translation.ja: ケンカでデイルームが 使えなくなる

translation.en: [male officer on PA] O-rec! Go to O-rec. Again, O-rec, go to O-rec.
translation.ja: 運動の時間だ　外に出て

translation.en: [inmate] Come on, you don't need to be on TV.
[inmate 2] I know
I'm finna watch.
[woman 1] Hey!
-[woman 2] Hey, girl! -[woman 1] Whatcha doing?
She's tryin to get at me, girl. Gotta get the good view.
translation.ja: その気にさせたら いい物を見せるわ

translation.en: [inmate] Look at these thirsty-ass thots.
I'll be out there to deal with ya. Ey!
translation.ja: 外で掛け合ってやろうか

translation.en: [woman 2] Oh, hell no! I'm gonna be on.
translation.ja: 冗談じゃない　見てるだけ

translation.en: It's hard to hear them. They're so far down there.
translation.ja: 歩行者の声は届かないわね

translation.en: [woman 1] It's heavy. I can tell.
translation.ja: きっとタフよ うん

translation.en: Yes.
[male officer on PA] All right, ladies, outdoor rec is over.
Please return to your cells.
translation.ja: 自分の房に戻るように

translation.en: [Rowland] Ladies! Why are we screwing up already?
translation.ja: ちょっと もう問題を起こしてるの？

translation.en: Quiet!
We could have easily put you guys on lockdown
for that little stint you guys pulled in outdoor rec.
translation.ja: 外で悪さをしたでしょ

translation.en: -[unintelligible protest] -Hold on!
There were a group of people screaming at people on the streets
translation.ja: 歩行者に怒鳴った人がいるわ

translation.en: and it caught someone's attention outside.
translation.ja: 外部の注目を集めたい？

translation.en: [inmate] Yes, we understand. We apologize.
Which one apologizes?
[inmate] It was an old man, and I couldn't tell if he was my lawyer.
translation.ja: 老人がいて弁護士かと思った

translation.en: There are many old men walking the streets of downtown Sacramento.
translation.ja: 老人は大勢 歩いてるわ

translation.en: I highly doubt that was your attorney in particular.
translation.ja: あなたの弁護士じゃない

translation.en: All right!
If you guys have questions, I will answer them as I do the next cell check.
translation.ja: 質問があれば答えます 次の点検の時にね

translation.en: [male officer on PA] Into your cells for lockdown.
translation.ja: ロックダウンの時間です

translation.en: -[male officer on PA] Hey, Beason. -[Shawn] Yes?
Beason, roll up your stuff. You're getting released.
translation.ja: 荷物をまとめろ　釈放だ

translation.en: -Okay, I'm rolled up. -[cellmate] Amen!
translation.ja: 分かった アーメン

translation.en: -[cellmate] Bye, girl! -[Shawn] Bye.
-[cellmate] Good luck! -[Shawn] Thank you. [cellmate] Don't forget.
translation.ja: 元気で　忘れないでね

translation.en: [woman] Are you going home?
[Shawn] Yeah, they just let me go.
[woman] Good luck, don't come back.
I'll try not to.
Alright, head on down towards the elevator for me, please.
Thank you. There you go.
Let a real one free.
[male officer] All right. There you go.
[Shawn] I don't want to do this forever. It's time for me to grow up.
translation.ja: もう戻りたくない 成長するわ

translation.en: I want to go back to school.
I'm willing to, you know, work hard, I guess, for money.
translation.ja: 仕事も一生懸命やって お金を稼ぐ

translation.en: And not just take it.
Hey, babe!
I'm in the release tank. You here to pick me up?
translation.ja: 釈放されるわ　来てる？

translation.en: [Christine] I'm here.
-Are you going to be in the same spot? -Yeah.
translation.ja: 前と同じ場所？ うん

translation.en: Okay, I'll see you in a minute. Okay?
All right.
[Shawn] My wife, I know that she loves me. She's there for me as much as she can right now, but it's tough for her.
translation.ja: 妻は私を愛して できるだけそばに居てくれる

translation.en: Every time I go to jail,
it seems like it's longer and longer each time I go back.
translation.ja: 刑期はどんどん長くなる

translation.en: Come on. My ride is waiting.
translation.ja: 行こう　迎えが待ってる

translation.en: We're a team, and when a piece of the team is gone, it just makes it hard.
translation.ja: チームだから１人欠けると つらくなる

translation.en: -Is there a Ms. Beason? -Yes.
Go ahead and step out right here.
Right around this way. Follow that yellow line down.
translation.ja: 黄色い線に沿って歩いて

translation.en: Stop right there.
Face the wall.
Officer? Why am I going in here?
Still in the process of processing your release.
translation.ja: まだ仮釈放の手続き中で―

translation.en: Your parole officer decided they wanted to place a hold.
translation.ja: 担当者が待つようにと

translation.en: So you're not gonna be going home at this time until your parole officer... takes care of all that.
translation.ja: だから今回は帰れない 手続きが終わるまではね

translation.en: [Shawn] Shit.
Oh, my gosh, this is crazy.
translation.ja: 何なんだよ　クレイジーだ

translation.en: [Hernandez] When I first was assigned to the Intel and Classification Unit,
translation.ja: 考査部門に入って 驚いたのですが

translation.en: everybody had a theme to their desk.
translation.ja: デスクにテーマがあるんです

translation.en: A football theme, puppies theme, and then they asked me,
translation.ja: フットボールとか子犬とか

translation.en: "What is your theme going to be?"
translation.ja: テーマを聞かれた時は 冗談かと思って

translation.en: And I thought it was a joke.
translation.ja: テーマを聞かれた時は 冗談かと思って エルナンデス巡査

translation.en: So I said, "I don't know, unicorns farting out rainbows?"
translation.ja: エルナンデス巡査 虹色のオナラをする ユニコーンと答えました

translation.en: Well, they decided to decorate my cubicle.
translation.ja: みんながそのテーマで ここを飾り出して

translation.en: So I just kept the theme and now we got it going.
translation.ja: みんながそのテーマで ここを飾り出して 今もそのまま

translation.en: It was at one point a really blowed-up unicorn
translation.ja: ユニコーンの風船もあります

translation.en: and it had Skittles coming out of the mouth.
We have to do our best in our facilities to ensure that everybody is safe.
translation.ja: 所内の安全を守るために 最善を尽くします

translation.en: It's in human nature for...
translation.ja: 人間の性(さが)でもあるけど

translation.en: especially inmates here to break rules and violate rules.
translation.ja: 囚人は規則を破るので それを見つけます

translation.en: We can't catch everything, but it happens.
translation.ja: 全部は無理ですけどね

translation.en: [Hernandez] Girls, get fully dressed.
Hawkins, control.
translation.ja: ホーキンス 起きて

translation.en: Jones, I need you in the classroom now.
translation.ja: ジョーンズ 教室へ

translation.en: -[Monster] What the fuck? -[Noonie] Why?
Get fully dressed.
[Monster] All right, we coming.
That hella fucked up, man.
translation.ja: クソ　やられたわね

translation.en: Because we have approximately 135 inmates that are booked daily,
translation.ja: 毎日 約135人が 入所してくるので―

translation.en: we try to conduct shakedowns as often as we can.
translation.ja: 点検はひんぱんにやります

translation.en: And sometimes, we can get tips from other inmates.
translation.ja: 問題がある房については たまに―

translation.en: They'll let us know, "Hey, something's going on in this cell."
translation.ja: 囚人から告発があります

translation.en: Do you want to go through this side and I'll go through this side.
translation.ja: あなたはこっち側を 見てくれる？

translation.en: Don't know why she has all this.
[Rowland] Table's clear.
[Noonie] Somebody snitched on me.
So, they raided my room.
They always like to throw around my shit.
translation.ja: いつも私物が捨てられる

translation.en: It was like a handful of people that knew I had pruno, so...
translation.ja: プルノを作ってたのを 知ってた人間は―

translation.en: bitches was hating.
[Rowland] This bag's clear.
We got some joy juice.
Some pruno.
[female officer] Oh, nice.
I'm hella mad, 'cause they probably found my pruno.
translation.ja: 悔しい　きっと見つかる

translation.en: [Rowland] Kickstart our Friday.
[female officer] Happy Friday.
I have disciplinary hearings for Hawkins and Jones out of 118.
translation.ja: 聞き取りをするわ ホーキンスとジョーンズ

translation.en: [Hernandez] Hi, Hawkins.
Sgt. Hernandez, I'm here to do your hearing.
translation.ja: ヘルナンデス巡査よ 聴聞します

translation.en: Hi, Jones. How are you?
Tired. I wanna go back to sleep.
[Hernandez] And I'm tired, too.
So apparently, some officers did some shakedowns
translation.ja: 部屋を点検した刑務官が―

translation.en: and they found a plastic bag, odor of an alcoholic beverage,
translation.ja: 酒の匂いがする袋を 見つけました

translation.en: and they found pruno in your cell.
I mean, it's just...
I don't know whose it is.
There's no way it was a gallon and a half.
How much do you think it was? Maybe a couple cups?
So you're pleading guilty or not guilty?
I plead the fifth.
[Hernandez] This is just basically in-house rules.
You're not gonna get extra charges if that's what you think.
translation.ja: 法的な刑罰は重くならない

translation.en: -Penal Code charges. -[Monster] I'm gonna say I'm not guilty,
translation.ja: 法的な刑罰は重くならない 有罪とは思わない 誰のか知らないわ

translation.en: because it's not... I don't know whose it is.
translation.ja: 有罪とは思わない 誰のか知らないわ

translation.en: Was it good stuff?
Did you make it? -No. -Did you even taste test it?
translation.ja: あなたが作ったの？ 飲んでみた？

translation.en: [Noonie] No. I wish I did.
So are you saying this is your stuff that was in here?
translation.ja: つまり あなたのお酒？

translation.en: No, I'm not saying that.
So whose pruno was it?
-Miraculously-- -I don't even know how to make pruno.
translation.ja: では誰のですか？ 作り方を知らない

translation.en: And you were just waiting to drink it.
So, some magical unicorn came into your cell and put this whole bag of pruno inside your cell.
translation.ja: つまり魔法のユニコーンが プルノを置いて行った

translation.en: Is that what you're telling me?
I appreciate you saying that you were ready to drink
translation.ja: 酒が部屋にあったのは 認めている

translation.en: and you knew it was in, acknowledged that it was in your cell.
translation.ja: 酒が部屋にあったのは 認めている そこは評価します

translation.en: I'm going to find you guilty, even though you plead not guilty. You're going to get the max of 15 days.
translation.ja: でも有罪とみなして 15日間 懲罰を与えます

translation.en: Do you know what it means to be on restriction? Have you been?
I can't come out in day room.
Yeah, no day room, you get a disciplinary shower every other day.
translation.ja: そうね　それと シャワーは２日に１度

translation.en: You're allowed to have legal mail and make legal phone calls,
translation.ja: 私的な手紙や電話も禁止

translation.en: and that is it.
Do you have any questions?
All right, go ahead and check back in and head back.
[Shawn] This is crazy.
Hi, I'm not getting released.
[Christine] What?
[Shawn] My parole officer put a parole hold on me.
translation.ja: 審査員が仮釈放を止めた

translation.en: I'm sorry, Christine.
translation.ja: ごめん　クリスティン

translation.en: This time I came to jail, it's been a struggle on me and my wife.
translation.ja: 今回はさすがにこたえたわ

translation.en: She isn't working, and she's doing the best that she can.
translation.ja: 妻は仕事をしてないから 苦労してる

translation.en: Do you love me?
Would you be able to do me a favor?
Could you send me some money?
Wow, are you serious right now?
Yes.
I don't have any. You need to grow up.
Now I gotta get back dressed into oranges.
[female officer] You're going to get completely undressed. Put everything in this bag.
Okay?
[inmate] Shawn? I thought you were leaving.
[Shawn] Bro, I'll tell you later.
[inmate] Okay.
I really did wanna drink that shit.
translation.ja: あんな酒 惜しくない

translation.en: Probably would've been good right now.
I wouldn't admit to it
even if I did or didn't make it. I'm not gonna admit to that.
translation.ja: 作ったかどうかなんて 答えない

translation.en: I'm not gonna incriminate myself or anybody um, in that matter.
translation.ja: このことで 誰のことも責める気はない

translation.en: I think she shoulda got ten days.
I think I should have gotten nothing, but--
Or, that's true.
Somebody... definitely opened their mouth.
translation.ja: 誰かがタレ込んだのよ

translation.en: It's... wrong.
There's no need for somebody else to put their nose in anybody else's business.
translation.ja: 他人がすることに 口を出すなんて

translation.en: [Monster] It's not really hard to figure out
translation.ja: 割と簡単に見つかるわ

translation.en: who's talking.
Especially in here. We have nothing but time to sit and listen
translation.ja: 情報交換か観察する以外に

translation.en: and observe.
translation.ja: 皆 やることがない

translation.en: No, they hit our room because somebody...
-Opened their mouth. -Yes.
[Monster] Whose?
You know?
The one who didn't want it.
translation.ja: 前に飲みたがらなかった あの女ね？

translation.en: [Monster] That bitch, right?
translation.ja: 前に飲みたがらなかった あの女ね？ ドレア

translation.en: [laughs] Uh-uh.
Okay, okay.
If you snitch, then you're going to get to meet my fist.
translation.ja: 裏切り者には 一発お見舞いする

translation.en: You're fucking with my freedom. And...
translation.ja: 私の自由をジャマした

translation.en: I know I fucked with my freedom by getting myself here. I don't need nobody else do it for me.
translation.ja: 自分のせいならいいけど 他人は許さない

translation.en: [inmate] We love you Monster and Noonie!
translation.ja: 好きよ モンスターとヌーニー

translation.en: [Noonie] Bitches is crazy.
I love it.
"Monster and Noonie, we love you!"
translation.ja: 私たちを愛してるってさ

translation.en: [yelling] Team Monster Gang! Yeah, yeah!
-[yells] Noonie Squad! -[both] Yeah, yeah!
[Monster] We need to let the whole jail know, let the guys know upstairs, knock on the bowl.
translation.ja: 上の男どもにも知らせてやる トイレからね

translation.en: Hello?
Hello!
Yo, Andrea Gunderson is a mother-fucking snitch
translation.ja: アンドレアは汚いチクリ魔よ

translation.en: and everybody needs to know.
Do what?
[male inmate] Let that bitch know snitching is a no-no.
translation.ja: チクれば痛い目を見る

translation.en: Yeah, that bitch snitching is a scaredy-ass bitch.
translation.ja: そうよ　あのビビり女

translation.en: You feel me? She's in her fucking cell--
-[male inmate] What cell is she in though? -She in 28.
[male inmate] It's always good to know about people like that
cause snitching is a no-no.
Snitching is a no-no, okay?
Fuck these snitches, man!
Yeah, I be talking on the toilet.
It's fun. It's better talking to the boys than these raggedy-ass girls all the time.
translation.ja: 汚い女と話すより 男と話す方が楽しい

translation.en: Hey, bruh.
-Hello? -Hello!
-Hello? -Who's this?
What are you doing?
I had just got here from juvenile hall and so, I didn't know anything about toilet talking or any of that.
translation.ja: 少年院から移ったばかりで 知らなかった

translation.en: My bunkie was like, "There's some guys banging on our line."
translation.ja: ルームメイトから 男と話すと聞いて―

translation.en: -Hello? -What are you talking about?
-Hello. -People were talking into the toilet?
translation.ja: ハロー トイレに話しかけてる

translation.en: -Like, really? -Yeah?
translation.ja: トイレに話しかけてる なに？

translation.en: I miss you!
So, to talk on the toilet bowl, you have to bail out.
translation.ja: トイレの水をくみ出して

translation.en: You take all the water out, dump it in the sink.
She bailed the toilet out and knocked, and somebody answered.
translation.ja: トイレを空にして ノックするなんて

translation.en: I was like, "Oh my God, what is happening here?"
translation.ja: 最初はどうかしてると思った

translation.en: Everybody has their own knock, because there's people on the eighth floor, on the sixth floor,
translation.ja: ノックの仕方も ８階や６階で違うのよ

translation.en: there's people on the fifth floor. You can even talk to the boys on the fourth floor.
translation.ja: ５階にもいるし ４階の男子とも話せる

translation.en: You can barely hear them, it's very quiet.
translation.ja: 聞こえにくいけどね うるさい　聞こえてる

translation.en: I hear you, motherfucker.
translation.ja: うるさい　聞こえてる

translation.en: Is there any bitches on the line?
[female inmate] I've been trying to get bitches on the line for a minute!
translation.ja: いないわ　少し待って

translation.en: And then you can, like, create a relationship.
I've been missing you all my life.
He was hella hot, and I was like, "Ooh, okay. Talk to me."
translation.ja: セクシーと言われると こっちも乗っちゃう

translation.en: This is my microphone. Hello?
translation.ja: これで話す ハロー

translation.en: Oh, hello?
I was like, "Oh, my gosh, this is so cool. It's like having a cell phone!"
translation.ja: 通じた時は感動した ケータイみたい

translation.en: Hey, you hear me?
Who is this?
-It's Graham. -I'm on six.
Nah, I'm a white boy.
-Whatcha want me to tell her? -I don't know who figured it out,
translation.ja: 伝言は？ 誰が始めたか知らないけど 天才ね

translation.en: but whoever first did it was a genius,
translation.ja: 誰が始めたか知らないけど 天才ね

translation.en: 'cause that's real science, for real.
All right.
He flushed, so he hung up the phone, so... That's it.
translation.ja: 電話を切る時はトイレを流す

translation.en: I see you, bitch.
Be cool.
Okay. Just...
[Monster] I'm in here for 15 days.
-You got 15 days lockdown? -Yeah.
They gave me 15 fucking days.
Damn.
Just leave it alone.
You know, it's not that big of a deal. Ain't no one going to do shit.
translation.ja: 大した事じゃないんだからさ

translation.en: Who is she talking to? Someone behind me? [chuckles] I know she ain't talking to me.
translation.ja: 誰に話しかけてんの？ 私じゃないわ

translation.en: [inmate] Stop it. Stop it.
We all know you tellin'.
translation.ja: あんたがチクったのよ

translation.en: Excuse me? That's one thing I'm not, is no snitch, bitch.
translation.ja: 私じゃないよ　ふざけんな

translation.en: You got me hella fucked up, bro. That's one jacket you ain't giving me. I will not wear that one.
translation.ja: 変なレッテルは 貼られたくないね

translation.en: You got me hella fucked up. Anyways, get on the phone.
translation.ja: いいから電話してろよ

translation.en: -[Princess] You're cute. -Get on the phone. I know I'm cute.
translation.ja: いいから電話してろよ 私は美人よ 少なくとも歯はそろってる

translation.en: Thank you. At least I got a full set of pearly whites, bitch.
translation.ja: 私は美人よ 少なくとも歯はそろってる

translation.en: Bitch, your teeth about to fall out, bro. -You look like a duck, bitch. -[inmate] Andrea.
translation.ja: あんたのは抜けそうで アヒルみたいだ

translation.en: -Huh? -Stop.
Ah shit. That shit's drama.
There's so many haters in here.
They are just jealous.
Okay. All right.
The whole issue with Drea is she speaks on people.
translation.ja: ドレアの問題は 告げ口が多いところね ドレアの問題は 告げ口が多いところね プリンセス

translation.en: There's multiple people who don't like her.
Drea, she's just always running at the mouth.
translation.ja: 彼女は考えもせずに しゃべるの 彼女は考えもせずに しゃべるの クリスティアナ

translation.en: It's like, either you run up or shut up.
translation.ja: ケンカするか 無視するしかない

translation.en: [Princess] Little Miss Monster.
Hey!
Hi, boo.
Some people aren't going to let it slide.
Not me. No more chances with me.
No more.
I don't know what she's doing, you feel me?
translation.ja: あの女　どういうつもり？

translation.en: [Princess] Bet you she won't.
Drea! Monster wants you.
translation.ja: ドレア モンスターが呼んでる

translation.en: Okay.
What's up?
I never said nothing about you from jump.
-[Monster] Bitch, hold on a second. -I never said nothing about you from jump.
translation.ja: 待ちな 告げ口してない

translation.en: [Monster] Pump your fucking brakes.
I'm not gonna talk to you if that's how you speak to me.
You can talk to me like a grown-ass woman.
[Monster] I am talking--
No, you're not, you're cussing at me.
Bitch, better calm the fuck down bitch.
[Drea] I'm done with you.
You're a fucking punk-ass...
Yeah, right. That all you have to say?
-[Noonie] Bitch, you're scary! -[Monster] Suck my dick, bitch!
translation.ja: ビビったか！ くたばれ

translation.en: I'm telling you, she's hella hard right now. Hella.
translation.ja: モンスターがメチャ怒ってる

translation.en: Go get your fucking teeth fixed, Princess!
[Princess] Step in the shower now!
Stop.
Step in the shower right now, though.
-[inmate] Stop! -Shut your dog-ass up, bitch.
You're hella ugly, bitch!
[inmate] Yeah, exactly. Stop.
Stop.
-[Princess] Meet me at the shower though -[inmate] Stop.
Look at me. Stop, please? Stop.
translation.ja: いいから やめてちょうだい

translation.en: That's why every bitch I've been talking to, you wanna get in on my nigga's line every single time.
translation.ja: 私が黒人と付き合うと 邪魔してくる

translation.en: That's why I snatched your bitch, that's right!
Miss me with that, bitch.
Go fix your teeth. With your ugly ass.
translation.ja: その歯を直してから 出直してきな

translation.en: Who do you think you're talking to, Drea? Who do you think you're talking to, Drea?
translation.ja: 誰に向かって口きいてんだ

translation.en: [control agent] Day room's on lockdown.
[male officer] We need to lock it down, now!
translation.ja: 今すぐ房に閉じ込めろ
